pidof gdm

no
this is called getting rid of that KDE shit
install "galternatives"
it's a nice tool for looking at the "Alternatives" system in Debian
basically when 2 packages provide the same function for some feature, whether it be a flash plugin (Adobe/Gnash/Swfdec) or a login manager (kdm/gdm/xdm/etc.), you can configure it with Alternatives
you will have to look down the list to find the DM and switch it over
when you find it, let me know what name it's listed as because i'm wondering myself!
i think it might be default-x-display-manager
I couldnt find anything related to DM options
did you find default-x-display-manager?
on the list on the left?
ok hold on let me see
sudo dpkg-reconfigure gdm
